_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES
The accidental release prevention and response policies for the Crawford Station are maintained by the Area Manager.  Roger Mills Gas Gathering, L.L.C. is committed to the safety and health of its employees, contractors, and visitors.  This commitment is demonstrated in the design, installation, operation and maintenance programs developed and implemented specifically for this facility.  Operation and maintenance personnel are trained in the appropriate emergency response procedures to follow in the event of an accidental release.  However, accident prevention is the ultimate goal and as such a site-specific mechanical integrity program is being implemented and maintained.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
The Crawford Station is located approximately 1.25 miles west of Hwy. 283 on county road E0800, north of Roll, OK.  It is a facility designed to separate and collect natural gas liquids (i.e. ethane, propane, butane and heavier hydrocarbons) that drop out of the natural gas carried in the gathering system pipes, and compress the remaining gas to delivery pressures.  The only process in the station that contains an above threshold quantity of a regulated substance is the NGL Storage Tank.  There are no above threshold quantity toxic substances at the Crawford Station.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
The Crawford Station has developed and implemented a site-specific accidental release prevention program that consists of a detailed facility mechanical integrity program and employee training program.  The mechanical integrity program was developed under the guidelines of manufacture written recommendations, recognized/generally accepted good engineering practices, industry/regulatory standards and past operation history.  Employee training was designed to ensure/document employee understanding of facility operation and maintenance requirements.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
Crawford Station

has only been in operation for one year, and has had zero accidental releases.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Being a Program 1 facility, we have coordinated emergency response efforts with local responders.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Roger Mills Gas Gathering believes safety is an issue that can always be improved upon.  RMGG continues to look for, develop and implement programs that will improve an employee's ability to identify and correct potential workplace hazards.  RMGG also endeavors to ensure policies, programs and procedures are developed and implemented to meet applicable laws, rules and regulations.  Employee understanding of the policies, programs and procedures is high priority.
